head.supplied: 12/2/60. ¶ My dear Mr Moore ¶ ¶ I have written officially on the desirability of sending £150 home to Mr Wilson out of my wages-fund. ¶ If this proposal is entertained, pray could the sum not go by ...

div.p: N60/1423, unit 748, VPRS 1189/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have written officially on the desirability of sending £150 home to Mr Wilson out of my wages-fund.
See M to W. Nicholson, 12 February 1860. If this proposal is entertained, pray could the sum not go by next mail?

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Ferd Mueller
On 17 February Moore minuted: 'As the contingent Vote for the Zoological & Botanic Gardens is to be restored to the Amount originally estimated Dr Mueller withdraws this application'.
